headline: HPE’s Juniper Deal and H3C Exit Might Change The Case For Investing In Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)
summary: In recent months, Hewlett Packard Enterprise completed its Juniper Networks acquisition, divested its Telco-Solutions unit, and confirmed plans to sell its remaining 19% H3C stake for about US$1.40 billion to cut leverage, while also lifting its fiscal 2026 earnings and free cash flow guidance after a record fiscal Q4. These moves show HPE reshaping its portfolio toward higher-margin networking, AI, and as-a-service offerings, even as at least one research firm stepped back from a short-term...
